bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas Ewart Marston was born on November 7, 1904, in Chicago, Illinois. He was educated at Yale (B.A. 1927) and Harvard (Ph.D. 1939), taught history, and was curator of classics in the Yale University Library. His books include Britain's Imperial Role in the Red Sea Area, 1800-1878, and The Vinland Map and the Tartar Relation. He died on February 25, 1984.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Thomas Ewart Marston Papers consist entirely of notes taken by Marston between 1936 and 1937 from documents in the British Public Records Office, the India Office, and the British Museum relating to Aden, Abyssinia, and Arabia from 1800-1878. Marston probably used this research in writing Britain's Imperial Role in the Red Sea Area, 1800-1878, which was published in 1961. The notes are arranged as Marston arranged them, by location of the records.
